source_sentence: 佛說眾許摩訶帝經卷第九
translation: Foshuo zhongshimahatei jing, vol. 9

source_sentence: 西天譯經三藏朝散大夫試鴻臚少卿
translation: Tripiṭaka of the Western Translation of the Sutra of the Buddha, Tathāgata, and Young Secretary of the Court

source_sentence: 明教大師臣法賢奉　詔譯
translation: Mingjiao dashi ministers, Faxian, in accordance with the imperial edict, translated

source_sentence: 爾時世尊度彼六十賢眾已，復思何人先可受化，乃憶西曩野儞聚落之中，有難那及長女并眷屬等堪先受化。
translation: After the Bhagavān had saved 60 of those good men, he then considered who would be the first to be converted, and remembered that there was a man named Nandana, his eldest daughter, and his retinue in the village of Nani in the West who would be the first to be converted.

source_sentence: 憶念：「我昔苦行去時經過彼舍，時難那及長女并眷屬等，共持乳粥及酥蜜等來獻於我。
translation: He remembered, "In the past, when I was going on an ascetic journey and passed by that house, Nanna, her eldest daughter, and their retinue brought milk gruel and butter and honey to offer to me.

source_sentence: 今觀彼等根緣已熟，堪可化度。」
translation: Now, I see that their faculties and conditions are ripe, and they're ready to be saved."

source_sentence: 作是念已，世尊翌日伺候食時，執持應器入西曩野儞聚落之中，次第乞食至難那舍。
translation: After he had this thought, the Bhagavān waited for the meal the next day, took the appropriate container, entered the village of Xionganonni, and went to Nanna's cottage in order to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 時彼難那及長女等，見佛至門踊躍歡喜，即謂佛曰：「善來世尊！
translation: Nanna and her eldest daughter rejoiced when they saw the Buddha arrive at their door, and they said to him, "Good, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 聖體安否？
translation: Is the body of the saint at peace?

source_sentence: 世尊大慈，暫過我舍。」
translation: The Bhagavān was so kind as to pass through my house for a moment."

source_sentence: 佛即入門，難那并女為佛敷座。
translation: The Buddha then entered the room, and Nandana and his daughter prepared a seat for him.

source_sentence: 世尊昇座，彼難那及女并諸眷屬，即以頭面禮佛雙足，各各禮已退坐一面。
translation: When the Bhagavān ascended to his seat, Nandana, his daughter, and their entourage bowed their heads and faces to the Buddha's feet, and after each bowed, they withdrew to sit to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊即為說法。
translation: The Bhagavān then began to preach the Dharma.

source_sentence: 佛言：「難那！
translation: The Buddha said, "Nandana!

source_sentence: 汝等諦聽！
translation: All of you, listen closely!

source_sentence: 布施、持戒生天之因，雖感欲樂終當退失，汝等當斷一切煩惱以求出離。」
translation: Although generosity and observance of precepts are the causes of birth in heaven, their desires and pleasures will eventually fade, so you must end all afflictions and seek escape."

source_sentence: 又復廣為分別生滅之法而令了知。
translation: Again, he extensively discriminated the law of arising and ceasing and made it known.

source_sentence: 佛說是時，彼難那等根緣成熟蓋障即除，深心思惟歡喜無量。
translation: When the Buddha said this, the hindrances were removed as soon as their faculties and conditions matured, and they profoundly contemplated and rejoiced immeasurably.

source_sentence: 佛即又為廣說苦、集、滅、道四聖諦法。
translation: The Buddha then explained in detail the four noble truths of suffering, arising, cessation, and the path.

source_sentence: 時難那并女及眷屬等，即於座上得法知見，證四諦理斷諸疑惑，貪愛永除一向信佛，即從座起合掌頂禮白言：「世尊！
translation: Thereupon, Nanna, her daughter, her retinue, and others attained knowledge and vision of the Dharma while they were seated, realized the principle of the four truths, ended their doubts and delusions, permanently removed their cravings, and believed in the Buddha as a whole. They rose from their seats, bowed their heads with their palms together, and said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我於世尊所說諸法實得知見，我今歸佛、歸法、歸依僧伽，願為近事永不殺生。」
translation: I really know and see the teachings of the Bhagavān, so now I take refuge in the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṃgha, and I vow to never kill anyone for the sake of proximity."

source_sentence: 又白佛言：「食時已至，願佛大慈受我供養。」
translation: He also said to the Buddha, "The time has come for us to eat, so I hope the Buddha will have great compassion and accept my offerings."

source_sentence: 佛即默然。
translation: The Buddha then remained silent.

source_sentence: 時彼難那并眷屬等，見佛默然知已受請，持種種香花飲食手自奉上。
translation: Seeing the Buddha's silence, Nandana and his retinue knew that they had accepted the invitation, and they brought various kinds of flowers, food, and drink and hand-delivered them to him.

source_sentence: 世尊食畢澡漱已竟，難那眷屬復處卑座樂欲聽法，佛即方便種種說法，難那眷屬復得聞法，歡喜踊躍，禮佛而退。
translation: After the Bhagavān had finished eating and rinsing, the Nanna's retinue resumed their lowly seats and longed to hear the Dharma, so the Buddha facilitated various teachings.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊於西曩野儞聚落化難那等已，即復思念，欲詣摩伽陀國隨緣利樂。
translation: After teaching Nanna and the others at the village of Xionganonian, the Bhagavān then again contemplated going to Magadha for their own benefit.

source_sentence: 時摩伽陀國有善相師烏嚕尾螺迦葉，壽年三百歲，自謂已得阿羅漢道，居尼連河側，弟子眷屬有五百人；摩伽陀國王及輔相一切民眾，皆尊重供養更無有上。
translation: At the time, there was this teacher of good characteristics in Magadha, Urūḍa-Kāśyapa, who was 300 years old, declared himself to have attained the path of the arhat, lived on the bank of the Naira River, and had 500 disciples and retinues; the king of Magadha and all the people who assisted him respected and supported him, and there was nothing higher.

source_sentence: 「彼摩伽陀國有無量人眾，由如盲冥黑暗障蔽，常依烏嚕尾螺以為引導，彼諸人眾雖承化導無由出離。
translation: "In that Magadha country, there are measureless crowds of people who are blind and obscured by darkness and who always rely on the crow's-nosed conch to guide them, and although they are guided by that guide, there's no way for them to escape.

source_sentence: 我今化彼烏嚕尾螺迦葉，及彼人眾，使見正道。」
translation: Now, I will teach that soul, Kāśyapa Ulūka, and that people, so that they will see the right path."

source_sentence: 既思惟已，行詣摩伽陀國尼連河側烏嚕尾螺迦葉住處。
translation: After he had finished this thought, he traveled to Kāśyapa Ulūḍi on the bank of the Naira River in Magadha and stayed there.

source_sentence: 時烏嚕尾螺迦葉忽見世尊來至住處，又見相好具足威德殊異，即前迎接復加恭敬，而謂佛言：「善來大沙門！
translation: Seeing the Bhagavān coming to his dwelling place and seeing his appearance fully endowed with great dignity, Urusiputra Kāśyapa suddenly greeted him, paid him further respect, and said to the Buddha, "Well come, great ascetic!

source_sentence: 先住何處？
translation: Where did you first stay?

source_sentence: 今忽至此。」
translation: Now, I've suddenly arrived here."

source_sentence: 即為世尊敷座請坐。
translation: He then prepared a seat for the Bhagavān and invited him to sit down.

source_sentence: 世尊就坐，彼烏嚕尾螺迦葉亦自就坐，即以種種言辭慰問世尊，世尊亦以種種方便開導教化。
translation: When the Bhagavān was seated, Urūḍa-Kāśyapa also took his seat and asked the Bhagavān about it in a variety of ways, and the Bhagavān guided and taught him with various methods.

source_sentence: 談論未竟，日已西暮，佛即告言：「今已日暮，我於汝舍有寂靜處欲寄一宿。」
translation: Before he finished his discourse, the sun was setting, and the Buddha told him, "It's late in the day, so I'd like to put you up for the night in a quiet place in your house."

source_sentence: 烏嚕尾螺迦葉白言：「大沙門！
translation: Ulu-oṭa-Kāśyapa said, "Great ascetic!

source_sentence: 我諸房舍眷屬在中，唯一靜處堪沙門宿；然此靜處毒龍在中，雖不悋惜恐有所損。
translation: Among the members of my retinue, there's only one quiet place where an ascetic can stay, but this quiet place is full of poisonous dragons, so even though I don't cherish it, I'm afraid I'll harm it.

source_sentence: 請自思之。」
translation: Please consider it for yourself."

source_sentence: 佛告烏嚕尾螺迦葉言：「但願見借，必無傷害。」
translation: The Buddha told Uluvilvā-Kāśyapa, "May I borrow it, and I won't be harmed."

source_sentence: 烏嚕尾螺迦葉告言：「若能爾者當自隨意。」
translation: Uluvilvā-Kāśyapa told him, "If you can do that, you'll do as you like."

source_sentence: 於是世尊即詣龍舍。
translation: The Bhagavān then went to the nāga's abode.

source_sentence: 佛於舍外洗足已便入龍舍，自布淨草跏趺而坐，佛即便入三摩地。
translation: After washing his feet outside the abode, the Buddha then entered the nāga's abode, spread out his own pure grass, sat cross-legged, and entered samādhi.

source_sentence: 時彼毒龍忽見世尊在舍中坐，即發瞋怒，乃作煙霧遍舍內外，於是世尊以神通力亦化煙霧；毒龍轉怒舍內火著，佛以神力亦化其火，佛與毒龍二火俱熾，時彼龍舍周遍內外成大火聚，火焰上騰明照遠近。
translation: When that poisonous dragon suddenly saw the Bhagavān sitting in the abode, he became angry and created smoke that spread inside and outside the abode, so the Bhagavān used his supernormal powers to also create smoke; when the poisonous dragon's anger turned and a fire started inside the abode, the Buddha used his supernormal powers to also create that fire, and both the Buddha and the poisonous dragon's fires were blazing, so the dragon's abode was surrounded by a great ball of fire that rose up and shone brightly from far and near.

source_sentence: 時彼迦葉常於夜分出觀星像，乃復觀見龍舍成大火聚，即便傷嘆：「苦哉！
translation: Kāśyapa, who often went out at night to look at the images of the stars, then again observed the great ball of fire forming in the dragon's abode and even exclaimed, "What a pain!

source_sentence: 苦哉！
translation: What suffering!

source_sentence: 彼端正沙門不聽我語，龍火熾盛百倍於常，可惜沙門必被傷害。」
translation: That upright ascetic won't listen to me, and the dragon's fire burns a hundred times hotter than normal; unfortunately, that ascetic will surely be harmed."

source_sentence: 時烏嚕尾螺迦葉及與眷屬，皆見大火熾盛之相。
translation: Uluvilvā-Kāśyapa and his retinue then all saw the image of a great fiery blaze.

source_sentence: 時彼毒龍知於世尊不能損害，又以自身亦大疲乏，乃息惡毒火便消滅；世尊是時亦攝神力，毒龍降伏收於鉢內。
translation: Knowing that the Bhagavān couldn't harm them, and because he was so tired, that poisonous dragon calmed its fire and went out.

source_sentence: 天曉之後，烏嚕尾螺迦葉與眷屬等，行詣龍舍觀於沙門。
translation: After sunrise, Urāḍī-Kāśyapa and his retinue went to the nāga's abode to observe the monks.

source_sentence: 既到龍舍，見佛端然而白佛言：「汝大沙門！
translation: When they arrived at the nāga's abode, they saw the Buddha standing straight ahead and said, "You great ascetic!

source_sentence: 宿夜安否？」
translation: Did you have a good night?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「我安。」
translation: The Buddha said, "I'm at peace."

source_sentence: 「汝大沙門，鉢中何物？」
translation: "You great ascetic, what do you have in your bowl?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「此舍之龍。」
translation: The Buddha said, "This is a dragon in this house."

source_sentence: 佛又告言：「汝言此舍有是毒龍，人不敢止；我今降伏收於鉢中，汝可審觀了知其實。」
translation: The Buddha also told them, "You said there was this poisonous dragon in this house that people wouldn't dare to stop, but now I've subdued it and put it in the bowl, so you can examine it and see what it really is."

source_sentence: 烏嚕尾螺迦葉自以耆年德重行苦學優，凡所見知無有過者，及見世尊龍火不傷又能降置鉢內，乃讚歎曰：「奇哉！
translation: Since he was an elder of great virtue, Uluvilvā-Kāśyapa had practiced hard and had learned well, and he knew of nothing wrong with what he saw. When he saw that the Bhagavān's dragon was unscathed by fire and could be lowered into the bowl, he praised him, "Amazing!

source_sentence: 沙門！
translation: śramaṇa!

source_sentence: 有大威力，我所見聞希有此事，是大沙門是大丈夫，亦是阿羅漢。」
translation: With great authority, this is something rare that I've seen and heard, which makes him a great ascetic, a great man, and an arhat."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊降毒龍已，至第二日即於烏嚕尾螺迦葉住處不遠，就一樹下經行宴坐，即於是夜有四大天王下來聽法。
translation: After the Bhagavān had subdued the poisonous dragon, on the second day he went to sit under a tree not far from Kāśyapa's dwelling and meditated there, and four great celestial kings came down that night to listen to the teaching.

source_sentence: 時迦葉夜出觀於星像，乃見佛前有四大火聚。
translation: When Kāśyapa emerged at night and looked at the star image, he saw four large fire gangs in front of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 迦葉即謂諸弟子曰：「彼大沙門亦事於火。」
translation: Kāśyapa then said to his disciples, "That great ascetic also works with fire."

source_sentence: 諸弟子曰：「師何由知？」
translation: The disciples said, "How does the teacher know that?"

source_sentence: 迦葉告言：「我夜觀星像，乃見大沙門前有四大火聚，我知沙門事火無疑。」
translation: Kāśyapa told him, "When I looked at the star images at night, I saw four large fire gangs in front of the great ascetic, and I knew there was no doubt that the ascetic was working with fire."

source_sentence: 時烏嚕尾螺迦葉纔至天曉，速詣佛所而白佛言：「汝大沙門！
translation: When Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa first arrived at dawn, he quickly went to the Buddha and said to him, "You great ascetic!

source_sentence: 亦事火耶？」
translation: Is it also a matter of fire?"

source_sentence: 佛即報言：「我不事火。」
translation: The Buddha then replied, "I don't work with fire."

source_sentence: 迦葉又言：「我夜中觀星，見沙門前有四火聚；若不事火，此乃何用？」
translation: Kāśyapa also said, "I was stargazing at night and saw four fire piles in front of the ascetic; if I don't work with fire, what's the point of that?"

source_sentence: 佛即報言：「此非是火，是四大天王下來聽法，是彼四天身光之耳！」
translation: The Buddha then replied, "This is not fire, but the Dharma heard from the four heavenly kings, which is the light of the bodies of the four celestials!"

source_sentence: 迦葉驚曰：「奇哉！
translation: Kāśyapa was astonished and said, "Amazing!

source_sentence: 沙門！
translation: śramaṇa!

source_sentence: 有是事也。
translation: "Is this also the case?

source_sentence: 此大沙門有斯威德，感得天王俱來聽法，此亦是阿羅漢耶？」
translation: Is this great ascetic who has such authority that he's persuaded the king of gods to come with him to listen to the teaching also an arhat?"

source_sentence: 至第三日，帝釋天主乃於夜分來至佛所，頭面禮足退坐一面，佛為帝釋如應說法。
translation: On the third day, Lord Indra came to the Buddha at night, bowed his head and feet, withdrew to sit at one side, and the Buddha taught the Dharma for Indra just as it should be.

source_sentence: 帝釋天主得聞法已，歡喜踊躍還歸天宮。
translation: After hearing the teaching, Lord Indra rejoiced and leaped for joy as he returned to his palace.

source_sentence: 時烏嚕尾螺迦葉夜觀星像，又見樹下世尊前面有一火聚，極大熾盛光明照耀，如日初出。
translation: At the time, Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa was watching the star images at night and saw a cluster of fires in front of the Bhagavān under a tree, shining with a great blazing brightness like the rising of the sun.

source_sentence: 而彼迦葉謂弟子曰：「而此沙門定事於火。」
translation: That Kāśyapa said to his disciples, "This ascetic is certainly working with fire."

source_sentence: 至天曉已，與諸弟子速詣佛所，而白佛言：「汝大沙門！
translation: When the sun rose, he and his disciples quickly went to the Buddha and said to him, "You great ascetic!

source_sentence: 我昨夜出觀於星像，又見火聚熾於座前，火光上騰如日初出，我今定知沙門事火。」
translation: Last night, I went out to look at an image of a star and saw a cluster of fires blazing in front of my seat, and their light rose up like the first sunrise; now I definitely know that ascetics are dealing with fire."

source_sentence: 佛即報言：「我非事火；昨夜帝釋下來聽法，是彼身光之所照耀。」
translation: The Buddha then replied, "I'm not dealing with fire; last night, Indra came down to listen to the teaching, and that was the light from his body that shone through."

source_sentence: 迦葉歎曰：「奇哉！
translation: Kāśyapa praised him, saying, "Amazing!

source_sentence: 沙門！
translation: śramaṇa!

source_sentence: 有大威德，此實希有；我今定知亦得阿羅漢果。」
translation: This is really rare. Now, I'm sure I know that I've also attained the fruit of the arhat."

source_sentence: 至第四日，烏嚕尾螺迦葉出門觀星，又復觀見沙門座前有大火聚，光明照耀如日正中。
translation: On the fourth day, Kāśyapa Urūḍa went out to look at the stars, and he again observed a large cluster of fires in front of the ascetic's throne, shining brightly like the middle of the sun.

source_sentence: 是時迦葉還告弟子：「我於今夜又觀星像，復見沙門座前有火，光明照耀轉倍於前，如日正中等無有異，審察是相定事火也。」
translation: Kāśyapa then also told his disciples, "This evening, I again looked at the star image and saw a fire in front of the ascetic's throne that shone brighter and brighter than before, just like the middle of the sun, and there was nothing different about it.

source_sentence: 至天曉已行詣佛所，而白佛言：「我夜觀星，亦見沙門座前有火，我知沙門定事火也。」
translation: When sunrise arrived, he went to the Buddha and said, "I looked at the stars that night and also saw a fire in front of the ascetic's throne, and I know that the ascetic is certainly making a fire."

source_sentence: 佛言：「迦葉！
translation: The Buddha said, "Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 我無所求，何用於火？
translation: I have nothing to seek, so why should I use it in the fire?

source_sentence: 昨夜之中，彼娑婆世界主大梵天王下來聽法在我前坐，汝所見者是彼身光。」
translation: Last night, that great Brahma king, the lord of the Saiva world, came down to listen to the teaching and sat down in front of me, and what you saw was his body in all its glory."

source_sentence: 時彼迦葉還復歎曰：「此大沙門乃有如是大威德力，能感梵王下來聽法，實為希有；我定得知亦證阿羅漢果。」
translation: That Kāśyapa then also praised him, "It's truly rare that this great ascetic has such great authority and power to cause a Brahma king to come down and listen to the teaching; I'm sure I'll learn that he'll also realize the fruit of the arhat."

source_sentence: 至第五日，時烏嚕尾螺迦葉弟子摩拏嚩迦等，五百人眾，俱事三火，各有三鑪，其鑪共有一千五百。
translation: On the fifth day, five hundred people from Mahānavaka and the rest of Kāśyapa's disciples at Ulūḍa-Kāśyapa worked on three fires, each with three coffins, and there were 1,500 of them.

source_sentence: 是時世尊在彼樹下，又值彼眾用火祭天。
translation: The Bhagavān was under that tree when the crowd offered fire to the gods.

source_sentence: 彼五百人常式發火火不能然，彼弟子眾即速告師，至烏嚕尾螺所而白言曰：「師可知否？
translation: When those five hundred people failed to make the fire in the usual way, the group of disciples quickly reported it to their teacher and went to Ulūḍi Luo and said, "Does the teacher know about this?

source_sentence: 我等然火，火終不然。
translation: We were all on fire, but the fire never ended.

source_sentence: 不知今日何因若此？」
translation: I wonder what caused this today?"

source_sentence: 烏嚕尾螺迦葉思惟是事：「而彼沙門在此近住，恐彼威力而有所制。」
translation: Uḍḍa-Kāśyapa thought about this, "Since that ascetic is living here, I'm afraid he might have some power to restrain him."

source_sentence: 即與弟子同詣佛所而白佛言：「汝大沙門！
translation: He then went with his disciples to the Buddha and said to him, "You great ascetic!

source_sentence: 我之弟子摩拏嚩迦五百人眾，常式用火而為火祀，今旦然火終不能著。
translation: My disciple Manuṣṭha's crowd of 500 people always used fire as a fire sacrifice, but now, once again, the fire never sticks.

source_sentence: 我疑此事，定是沙門威力所制。」
translation: I suspect that this must be due to the authority of the ascetics."

source_sentence: 佛即答言：「汝欲火然？」
translation: The Buddha then answered, "Do you want the fire to burn?"

source_sentence: 迦葉答言：「欲然。」

source_sentence: 佛言：「汝但還去，必自滅。」

source_sentence: 迦葉迴還，火已滅矣。

source_sentence: 又復歎曰：「此大沙門有是神力，亦阿羅漢也。」

source_sentence: 至第六日，烏嚕尾螺迦葉自欲用火祭其火天，火又不然，即自入定欲令火然，火亦不然。
translation: On the sixth day, Uruvilvā-Kāśyapa himself wanted to sacrifice fire to the fire deity, but the fire wouldn't come out, so he went into meditation and wanted to make the fire come out, but it didn't come out either.

source_sentence: 來至佛所而白佛言：「我自用火，常式得然；今不能然，莫是沙門力所制也？」
translation: He came to the Buddha and said, "I've always used fire myself, but now I can't. Could it be because of the ascetic's power to control it?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「迦葉！

source_sentence: 汝欲火然？」

source_sentence: 答言：「欲然。」

source_sentence: 佛言：「但去，火必自然。」

source_sentence: 迦葉迴還，火已然矣。

source_sentence: 用火事訖欲滅其火，火又不滅，又復入定欲令火滅，火終不滅。
translation: After using the fire, he wanted to extinguish it, but it didn't go out again. He then went back to meditation again, wanting to make the fire go out, but it never did.

source_sentence: 事不獲免，來白佛言：「火雖得然，今又不滅。

source_sentence: 佛言：「但去，火必自滅。」

source_sentence: 及至還家，火已滅矣。
translation: When he returned home, the fire had already gone out.

source_sentence: 火滅已後，以彼餘炭積於一處。
translation: After the fire went out, he put the rest of the coals in one place.

source_sentence: 移時之後其炭自然，與諸弟子同滅其火，盡其力分終不能滅。
translation: After moving it, the coals naturally extinguished the fire with the disciples, but as long as they had their strength, they couldn't extinguish it.

source_sentence: 又來白佛：「汝大沙門！
translation: He also came back to the Buddha and said, "You great ascetic!

source_sentence: 火適得滅，今還自然熾盛倍常，我不能滅。

source_sentence: 此必沙門力所制也。」

source_sentence: 佛言：「火又然耶？」
translation: The Buddha said, "And what about the fire?"

source_sentence: 答言：「火然。」
translation: He replied, "So it is with fire."

source_sentence: 「汝不能滅耶？」
translation: "You can't put it out, can you?"

source_sentence: 答言：「我不能滅。」
translation: He replied, "I can't put it out."

source_sentence: 佛即報言：「汝但迴去，火自息滅。」
translation: The Buddha then replied, "Just turn away, and the fire will go out by itself."

source_sentence: 迦葉即迴，火已自滅。
translation: Kāśyapa then turned back, and the fire went out on its own.

source_sentence: 迦葉歎曰：「奇哉！
translation: Kāśyapa praised him, saying, "Amazing!

source_sentence: 沙門！
translation: śramaṇa!

source_sentence: 有斯力也。
translation: "It has this power, too.

source_sentence: 我欲然火，火不能然，告以得然；我欲滅火，火不能滅，告以得滅。
translation: I wanted to make the fire burn, but it couldn't be made to burn, and I told them it would be made to burn; I wanted to put out the fire, but it couldn't be put out, and I told them it would be put out.

source_sentence: 今火再著，不能再滅；今火得滅，亦由彼力。
translation: Now, when the fire reappears, it can't be put out again, and now it's possible to put out the fire because of that power.

source_sentence: 是大沙門有大威德，此實希有，必應亦是阿羅漢也。」
translation: This great ascetic has great authority and virtue; it's really rare, and he surely must be an arhat as well."

source_sentence: 過是日已，烏嚕尾螺迦葉作外道法設七日會，彼摩伽陀國王士庶皆悉聞知。
translation: After that day, Kāśyapa Urūḍa created a seven-day assembly of non-Buddhist teachings, and the king of that Magadha country and his people all heard about it.

source_sentence: 迦葉思惟：「今大沙門在此近住，前所火祀皆能力制，今所作法莫復制耶？
translation: Kāśyapa thought, "Now that a great ascetic is living here, he's capable of controlling the fire sacrifice that he made earlier.

source_sentence: 若彼沙門七日不來，我法必成；若復來者，或恐被制。」
translation: If that ascetic doesn't come for seven days, my teaching will surely be accomplished; if he comes again, he might be afraid of being restrained."

source_sentence: 又作是念：「彼大沙門相好端嚴，威德殊勝，國中士庶若見殊勝，或恐捨我而事於彼。」
translation: Again, he thought, "That great ascetic has a finely proportioned appearance and outstanding authority, and if the people of that country see that excellence, they might fear abandoning me and working for him."

source_sentence: 以斯事故思念再三。
translation: He thought about this thought three times.

source_sentence: 佛即尋知，佛於七日他處遊化，雖在近住，迦葉及眾於七日中不見世尊。
translation: The Buddha then found out that the Buddha had traveled to other places for seven days to teach, and although he was staying nearby, Kāśyapa and the crowd hadn't seen the Bhagavān during those seven days.

source_sentence: 時彼迦葉作七日法，國中士庶悉持香花及與財寶，廣作供養。
translation: For seven days, Kāśyapa then performed the ritual, and the people of that country brought flowers, incense, and treasures to make offerings.

source_sentence: 作法既畢設會亦終，却復思念：「彼大沙門七日不見，我今設會多有餘長，沙門若來甚有供養。」
translation: After he finished performing the ritual and finished setting up the assembly, he then thought, "That great ascetic didn't see us for seven days, so now I've set up an assembly that's quite a bit longer, and if ascetics come, they'll have a lot of offerings."

source_sentence: 作是念已，佛知其意，即便行詣迦葉住處。
translation: After he had thought this, the Buddha knew what he wanted and went to Kāśyapa's dwelling place.

source_sentence: 迦葉纔見心即歡喜：「此大沙門我思便至。」
translation: As soon as he saw him, Kāśyapa rejoiced at heart, "This is a great ascetic whom I was thinking of visiting."

source_sentence: 乃白佛言：「沙門來耶！」
translation: He then said to the Buddha, "An ascetic has come!"

source_sentence: 佛言：「我來！」
translation: The Buddha said, "I'm coming!"

source_sentence: 又曰：「七日之中何以不來？」
translation: He also asked, "Why didn't you come during the seven days?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「汝作是念：『我設七日法會，若彼沙門來者恐法不成。』
translation: The Buddha said, "You think, 'I've set up a Dharma assembly for seven days, but if that ascetic comes, I'm afraid the Dharma won't be accomplished.'

source_sentence: 我知汝意是以不來。
translation: I know what you think, so you won't come.

source_sentence: 今汝思念：『作法已畢，沙門若來甚有供養。』
translation: Now, you think, 'After performing the ritual, if an ascetic were to come, there would be great offerings.'

source_sentence: 我亦知爾，是以此來。」
translation: I know this, too, and so I've come."

source_sentence: 迦葉思惟：「此大沙門是大聖者，悉知我意，必定亦是阿羅漢也。」
translation: Kāśyapa thought, "This great ascetic is a great sage who fully understands my intentions and must also be an arhat."

source_sentence: 佛與迦葉言論已竟，尋還所止。
translation: After the Buddha had finished speaking with Kāśyapa, he returned to his lodging.

source_sentence: 迦葉於後以虔潔心造諸飲食，極令香美異其常品，待至來日自詣佛所，白言：「沙門！
translation: Kāśyapa then prepared a meal with a reverent and pure heart, making it quite fragrant and beautiful beyond the usual, and then went to the Buddha himself on a future day and said, "Ascetic!

source_sentence: 我以專心備辦食竟，願過我舍而受供養。」
translation: After I finish preparing food with focused attention, I'd like to pass through my house and accept offerings."

source_sentence: 佛受請已而告之曰：「汝但先去，吾當便至。」
translation: After accepting the invitation, the Buddha told him, "Just go ahead, and I'll be right there."

source_sentence: 迦葉既去，世尊入三摩地，由如壯士屈伸臂頃，於贍部洲界取贍部樹果，盛滿鉢已迴還，先至迦葉住處跏趺而坐。
translation: After Kāśyapa left, the Bhagavān entered samādhi, and like a strong man who flexes and stretches his arms, he took the fruit of the Jambū tree from the Jambū region, filled his bowl, returned, and went to sit cross-legged where Kāśyapa was staying first.

source_sentence: 迦葉後至，見佛先到驚而言曰：「沙門來耶！」
translation: When Kāśyapa arrived later, he was surprised to see that the Buddha had arrived first and said, "Is that an ascetic here?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「我來久矣。」
translation: The Buddha said, "I've been here a long time."

source_sentence: 迦葉又言：「從何道來？」
translation: Kāśyapa also said, "From what path have you come?"

source_sentence: 佛即報言：「我從住處往贍部洲界取贍部樹果，還來於此。」
translation: The Buddha then reported, "I went to the Jambudvīpa region from where I was staying to get the fruit of the Jambudvīpa tree and returned here."

source_sentence: 迦葉言：「大沙門乃有如是神通迅疾，於少時間能往於彼取果還來，此大沙門亦是阿羅漢也。」
translation: Kāśyapa said, "That great ascetic has such supernormal powers and is so quick that he could go there and get the fruit and return it in a little while, so this great ascetic is also an arhat."

source_sentence: 佛即以果示之：「迦葉！
translation: The Buddha then showed him the fruit, "Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 汝曾見不？」
translation: Have you ever seen it?"

source_sentence: 迦葉言：「我未曾見。」
translation: Kāśyapa said, "I haven't seen that before."

source_sentence: 佛言：「汝樂食不？」
translation: The Buddha said, "Do you enjoy eating?"

source_sentence: 答言：「樂食。」
translation: He replied, "I'm happy to eat."

source_sentence: 佛言：「隨意。」
translation: The Buddha said, "As you like."

source_sentence: 迦葉食果歎未曾有。
translation: Kāśyapa then ate the fruit and admired it as never before.

source_sentence: 食果已竟，即以所造種種飲食自手奉上。
translation: When he had finished eating the fruit, he offered his own hand to the various foods he had made.

source_sentence: 佛喫食已澡漱亦畢，即為迦葉說偈，祝願訖，尋迴樹下。
translation: After he had eaten and washed himself, the Buddha spoke a verse for Kāśyapa, blessed him, and returned to the foot of the tree.

source_sentence: 又第二日請佛受供，佛即依前入三摩地，往弗婆提取菴摩羅果，先至迦葉住處。
translation: On the second day, he asked the Buddha to accept an offering, and he entered samādhi in the same way as before, went to Pūrva to extract the fruit of amala, and first went to Kāśyapa's dwelling.

source_sentence: 又第三日請佛受供，佛入三摩地，往西衢陀洲取得尾螺迦閉他果，還來先至迦葉住處。
translation: On the third day, he asked the Buddha to accept the offering, entered samādhi, went to West Quddha, obtained the fruit of conch-skulled Kārttika, and returned to Kāśyapa's abode.

source_sentence: 至第四日請佛受供，佛即入三摩地，如屈伸臂頃，往北俱盧洲取自然米飯鉢中持來，先至迦葉住處安坐，已久迦葉方來。
translation: On the fourth day, he asked the Buddha to accept an offering, and he entered samādhi like a man flexing and stretching his arm, went to the northern continent of Kuchea, took a bowl of natural rice, and came back to sit at Kāśyapa's dwelling place.

source_sentence: 迦葉又問：「自何道來？」
translation: Kāśyapa then asked, "What path did you come from?"

source_sentence: 佛答：「迦葉！
translation: The Buddha replied, "Kāśyapa!

source_sentence: 我適往彼北俱盧洲，取自然米飯持來至此。」
translation: I was just on my way to that northern continent to get some natural rice and bring it here."

source_sentence: 迦葉歎曰：「此大沙門有是神通，必是亦得阿羅漢果。」
translation: Kāśyapa praised him, "This great ascetic has this kind of superknowledge; he must have also attained the fruit of the arhat."

source_sentence: 佛還問言：「北洲之飯汝樂食耶？」
translation: The Buddha also asked, "Would you enjoy eating the rice from the northern continent?"

source_sentence: 答言：「樂食。」
translation: He replied, "I'm happy to eat."

source_sentence: 佛言：「隨意。」
translation: The Buddha said, "As you like."

source_sentence: 迦葉食已歎未曾有，於是以自所辦種種飲食奉上於佛。
translation: After eating, Kāśyapa admired what he had never seen before and then presented the Buddha with a variety of foods that he had prepared.

source_sentence: 佛受食竟澡漱亦畢，即為迦葉說偈，祝願已，還歸樹下。
translation: After he had finished eating and rinsing himself, the Buddha spoke a verse for Kāśyapa, blessed him, and returned to the tree.

source_sentence: 世尊來日乃自持鉢往四大王天，直至忉利天取天酥味，還來所止樹下而食。
translation: On the coming day, the Bhagavān took his bowl to the four great king gods and went up to the Heaven of the Thirty-three to obtain a taste of heavenly butter, which he returned to eat under the tree where he had been staying.

source_sentence: 喫食既畢，思水澡漱。
translation: After he finished his meal, he contemplated washing himself with water.

source_sentence: 帝釋天主知佛思水，如展臂頃來至佛所，白世尊言：「欲水用耶？」
translation: Knowing that the Buddha was longing for water, Lord Indra came to the Buddha with his arms outstretched as he approached and said to the Bhagavān, "Do you want water for that?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「欲水。」
translation: The Buddha said, "I want water."

source_sentence: 帝釋即觀近地先有涸池，以手指之，水即湧出，清淨香潔無與等者。
translation: Indra then observed a dried-up pond near the ground and pointed his finger, and water welled up, pure and clean with a fragrance like no other.

source_sentence: 佛即澡漱隨意受用。
translation: The Buddha then rinsed it and took it as he liked.

source_sentence: 帝釋天主還歸天宮。
translation: Lord Indra returned to the palace.

source_sentence: 迦葉忽見驚怪非常：「而此涸池無水已久，今復水滿，不知何來？」
translation: Kāśyapa was suddenly surprised to see it, "This dried-up pond has been without water for a long time, but now it's full of water again; I wonder where it came from?"

source_sentence: 速至佛所而白佛言：「大沙門！
translation: He quickly went to the Buddha and said, "Great monk!

source_sentence: 此池久涸，水因何有？」
translation: This pond has dried up for a long time; what is the cause of the water?"

source_sentence: 佛即報言：「今日食畢無水澡漱，帝釋遙知，乃下天來為我出水。」
translation: The Buddha then reported, "Today, after we finished eating, we had no water to wash ourselves, and Indra knew it and came down from the heavens to get water for me."

source_sentence: 迦葉歎言：「未曾有也！
translation: Kāśyapa praised him, saying, "Never has it happened before!

source_sentence: 食從天取，水令天出，能感如是，此必亦得阿羅漢也。」
translation: When food is taken from the gods and water is made to flow from the gods, this must also be the attainment of arhatship if it's possible to effect such a thing."

source_sentence: 迦葉乃立池名，謂之播抳佉多。
translation: Kāśyapa then created a name for the pond, which he called Pāṇḍakhaṭṭa.

source_sentence: 佛於後時入池澡浴，池岸之側先有大樹，名阿祖囉曩，佛以袈裟挂於樹上，迦葉來至見佛袈裟挂於樹上，知佛澡浴即來瞻覩。
translation: When the Buddha later entered the pond to bathe, there was a large tree on the bank of the pond named Ajurānā, and the Buddha had hung his robe on the tree.

source_sentence: 佛既浴訖，出水上岸，即展其手欲攀樹枝，時阿祖囉曩枝便低亞。
translation: When the Buddha had finished bathing and had gotten out of the water onto the shore, he spread out his arms and tried to climb on a branch of the tree, but the branch of the Ājñāta-raṇḍa then fell low.

source_sentence: 迦葉乃見，還復歎曰：「此大沙門實不思議，感得無情自然低亞，沙門亦得阿羅漢也。」
translation: Kāśyapa then saw this and again praised him, "This great ascetic is really inconceivable; he's overcome the natural tendency of the insentient to lower themselves, and the ascetic has also attained arhatship."

source_sentence: 世尊後時思欲洗衣：「云何得石而為用耶？」
translation: The Bhagavān then considered whether to wash it, "How did you get that stone to use?"

source_sentence: 帝釋遙知，尋至佛所白言：「世尊！
translation: Aware of this, Indra looked for the Buddha and said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 佛欲洗衣而用石耶？」
translation: Does the Buddha want to wash clothes but use stones?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「要石。」
translation: The Buddha said, "I want a rock."

source_sentence: 帝釋即令夜叉於大山中取石一塊，修令平正復使光潔，置於池側。
translation: Indra then had Yakṣa take a stone from a large mountain, make it level and shiny, and put it beside a pond.

source_sentence: 佛即洗衣，洗已欲曬。
translation: The Buddha then washed it, and after washing it, he wanted to dry it in the sun.

source_sentence: 帝釋又令夜叉別取一石置於池岸，佛洗衣竟就石曬之。
translation: Tīrṣa also told Yakṣa to take another stone and place it on the bank of the pond, so the Buddha washed and dried it.

source_sentence: 迦葉來至，又見池岸忽然有石，乃自驚怪：「池岸先無，今從何來？」
translation: When Kāśyapa arrived, he saw that there was suddenly a stone on the bank of the pond and wondered, "The bank of the pond was not there before; where did it come from now?"

source_sentence: 而白佛言：「大沙門！
translation: He said to the Buddha, "Great monk!

source_sentence: 池岸之石自何而有？」
translation: Where did the rock on the bank of the pond come from?"

source_sentence: 佛即報言：「我欲洗衣為無石故，即起思念，帝釋下來為我安置；我又思念無處曬衣，彼天帝釋又安一石。
translation: The Buddha then reported, "When I wanted to wash my clothes because I didn't have a stone, I immediately gave rise to the thought that Tīrṣa had come down and placed it for me.

source_sentence: 二石所來，皆帝釋也。」
translation: Both stones came from Śakra."

source_sentence: 迦葉大歎：「此大沙門，凡是所作非世之有，必已證得阿羅漢也。
translation: Kāśyapa greatly praised them, "This great ascetic, whose actions are not worldly, must have realized the arhat.

source_sentence: 然其所證應莫超吾。」
translation: Still, nothing he's realized should surpass mine."

source_sentence: 迦葉之心似有省悟，世尊又以方便更現異相，教化迦葉令入正道。
translation: As Kāśyapa's mind seemed to awaken, the Bhagavān then used another method to show a different sign and teach Kāśyapa to enter the right path.

source_sentence: 佛即化彼尼連河水忽然汎溢，居河左右人多漂溺，枯涸陂池處處皆滿，佛所止處正居其內，佛以神力令水環遶，四面壁立中心塵起。
translation: The Buddha then transformed the Nairañjanā River into a river that suddenly overflowed, leaving many people drowning on its banks and dried-up ponds overflowing everywhere, and within which the Buddha was standing, the Buddha used his supernormal powers to cause the water to surround him, standing up on all sides with dust rising from its center.

source_sentence: 迦葉是時見河汎溢最盛於常，即思念言：「彼大沙門得不漂溺？」
translation: Seeing the river overflowing more than ever, Kāśyapa then thought, "Would that great ascetic not be submerged?"

source_sentence: 由是乘船速至佛所，乃見世尊樹下經行步步塵起，又以環水壁立不能下船，歎異倍常，遙相慰曰：「沙門安否？
translation: They quickly arrived at the Buddha's place in a boat and saw the Bhagavān walking under a tree, standing on a ledge surrounded by water, unable to get off the boat, and admiring the difference in the norm, they comforted him from afar, saying, "Is the ascetic comfortable?

source_sentence: 得無憂惱耶？」
translation: Have you attained freedom from grief?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「我無憂惱，勞相諭也。」
translation: The Buddha said, "I have no sorrow or distress, and I labor to advise you."

source_sentence: 復思念言：「此大沙門自有神通，何不離此？」
translation: Again, he thought, "This great ascetic has his own supernormal powers, so why don't you leave him here?"

source_sentence: 迦葉又言：「莫欲乘船離於此耶？」
translation: Kāśyapa also said, "Don't you want to leave here by boat?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「欲離於此。」
translation: The Buddha said, "I want to get out of here."

source_sentence: 迦葉白言：「若欲離者當自上船。」
translation: Kāśyapa said, "If you want to get out, you'll get into the boat yourself."

source_sentence: 佛以神力，如彈指頃，已在船中跏趺而坐。
translation: With miraculous powers, the Buddha was sitting cross-legged in the boat in a matter of a snap of his fingers.

source_sentence: 迦葉見佛已坐，不見所來所入。
translation: Kāśyapa saw that the Buddha had sat down and didn't see what had come or gone in.

source_sentence: 迦葉歎言：「沙門是大丈夫，有大威德，乃有神通能如是也。」
translation: Kāśyapa praised him, saying, "That ascetic is a great man with great authority, and he has the supernormal power to do this."

source_sentence: 迦葉白言：「我自亦得阿羅漢果，然不及沙門所證之道。」
translation: Kāśyapa said, "I myself have also attained the fruit of the arhat, but it's not as great as the ascetic's path of realization."

source_sentence: 佛知迦葉決定迴心，便即告言：「汝自言證阿羅漢者，非實證也！」
translation: Knowing that Kāśyapa was determined to change his mind, the Buddha then told him, "You said you realized the arhatship, but you didn't really realize it!"

source_sentence: 迦葉忽聞世尊發如是語，身毛皆竪轉自尅責：「此大沙門悉能知我種種之事，今宜師之以進其道。」
translation: When Kāśyapa suddenly heard the Bhagavān speak thus, his hair stood on end and he began to rebuke himself, "This great ascetic knows all sorts of things about me, so now it's better to train him to advance on the path."

source_sentence: 作念已定而白佛言：「大沙門！
translation: After he concentrated on that thought, he said to the Buddha, "Great ascetic!

source_sentence: 願知我意，今欲於大沙門法中出家而為僧伽，稟奉教勅修持梵行，唯願慈悲特賜聽許。」
translation: Please know my intention. I now wish to leave home and become a monk in the order of great ascetics, and I have been instructed to cultivate the religious practice, so please have the compassion to grant permission."

source_sentence: 佛知迦葉證道時至，又以方便化彼徒眾，乃謂迦葉曰：「汝欲於吾法中出家學道為沙門者，還曾令諸弟子悉知已否？」
translation: Knowing that the time had come for Kāśyapa to realize the way, and using skillful means to convert his disciples, the Buddha said to Kāśyapa, "Have you told your disciples yet that you want to leave home and train as a monk in my teaching?"

source_sentence: 迦葉答言：「弟子未知。」
translation: Kāśyapa answered, "I don't know."

source_sentence: 佛言：「汝為人師，不得卒暴。
translation: The Buddha said, "As a teacher of men, you mustn't be hasty.

source_sentence: 且可歸還與弟子議，若謂然者即可再來，斯亦未晚。」
translation: Perhaps you could return to your disciples and discuss it with them; if you think that's the case, you can come back again; it's not too late."

source_sentence: 迦葉奉教還至住處，乃與摩拏嚩迦等五百弟子同集一處，告而言曰：「彼大沙門相好異常神通難及，凡所動止天悉遙知，或來座前而聽其法，或有要用皆能給送，累見神變我實不如。
translation: Kāśyapa complied with the teaching and returned to his dwelling. He gathered at the same place as five hundred other disciples, including Manāmaka, and told them, "That great ascetic has extraordinary features and unsurpassed superknowledge, and he's always able to know from afar what moves and calms gods, come to sit in front of him and listen to his teaching, or give him a gift if he has an essential need, so I'm really not as good as those who have seen miraculous powers.

source_sentence: 今欲師彼出家以進其道。
translation: Now, I want to train him to leave home and further his path.

source_sentence: 吾已決定，汝等如何？
translation: I've made up my mind, but what about you?

source_sentence: 細自籌量以實報我。」
translation: He carefully calculates it himself and truly repays me."

source_sentence: 摩拏嚩迦白迦葉言：「彼火龍暴惡首先降伏，神異他心眾人目覩。
translation: Mathurāḍaka said to Kāśyapa, "That fiery dragon's fierceness and unwholesomeness were first subdued, and its demeanor was different from that of others for the eyes of everyone.

source_sentence: 我等所業悉自師傳，師既未如，弟子何說。
translation: We all inherited our karma from our master, but since our master didn't do it, how could the disciples say anything?

source_sentence: 師若決志，我等皆隨；師若達彼宗源，亦願垂於濟度，我等已決眾共一心，今或可行不可失也。」
translation: If the teacher is determined, we'll all follow; if the teacher reaches the origin of that school, he'll also wish to help and save us; we've already decided that we're all united in one mind, and now it might work; we can't lose it."

source_sentence: 於是迦葉知眾誠願，乃令弟子取事火具，護摩杓等種種之器，及鹿皮衣、樹皮衣、淨瓶、拄杖、革屣等物，悉棄尼連河中，以示不迴之相，師徒相率同詣佛所，頂禮佛足退立一面。
translation: Knowing their sincerity, Kāśyapa then had his disciples take the fire-works equipment, the fire-keeper's ladle, and other utensils, the deerskin robe, the tree skin robe, the pure vase, the staff, and the leather sandals, and throw them all into the Naira River to show that they wouldn't turn back, and the master and disciples went to the Buddha in groups, bowed their heads at his feet, and withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊謂迦葉曰：「汝復來耶？」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Kāśyapa, "Are you coming again?"

source_sentence: 迦葉答言：「今與弟子同來，欲於大沙門法中出家修學。」
translation: Kāśyapa answered, "Now, I've come with my disciples to leave home and train in the teachings of a great ascetic."

source_sentence: 佛已懸知乃更審曰：「汝諸弟子誠心以否？」
translation: After he had readily understood this, the Buddha further examined him, "Are your disciples sincere in their resolve?"

source_sentence: 迦葉答言：「我與弟子皆悉誠心，唯願慈哀咸垂濟度。」
translation: Kāśyapa replied, "My disciples and I are all sincere, so please have mercy and grant us deliverance."

source_sentence: 佛即默許度為沙門，又復報言：「汝等今朝是真出家、是真梵行，披袈裟衣而實沙門。」
translation: The Buddha then acquiesced and declared, "Now, you really are renunciant monks, you really are practicing purity, you've put on the reddish-brown robes, and you're really monks."

source_sentence: 爾時烏嚕尾螺迦葉身著袈裟成沙門相，又聞佛言：「汝今是真出家、是真梵行。」
translation: It was then that Urūḍa-Kāśyapa, wearing the reddish-brown robes, assumed the characteristics of a monk and heard the Buddha say, "Now, you are truly renunciant and truly practicing the religious life."

source_sentence: 私自慶喜我心全滅。
translation: He personally rejoiced that his mind had completely ceased.

source_sentence: 又復思惟：「往昔大仙嘗說斯事：『世稀有佛出興於世，得無上覺具一切智，是大聖人天上人間悉能利樂。』
translation: Again, I thought, "Did great sages say this in the past, 'Such rare buddhas arise in the world, attain unsurpassed awakening, and possess omniscience, and such great noble people up in heaven and among humans are able to bring benefit to all of them?'

source_sentence: 我於前時夜出觀星有大火聚，謂其事火與我同宗，乃是梵王、帝釋、四天王等互來聽法。
translation: When I went out at night and observed a great cluster of fires on the stars, I thought that the fires in question were from the same school as mine, and that they were the Brahma kings, Indra's palace, and the four heavenly kings who had come to listen to each other's teachings.

source_sentence: 今惟此事是大聖人，此非大聖，孰為聖也？」
translation: Now, this is the only thing that's a great sage; if this isn't a great sage, who is a sage?"

source_sentence: 於是迦葉易沙門稱，呼佛為世尊也。
translation: Kāśyapa then changed his title to śramaṇa and called the Buddha the World Honored One.

source_sentence: 佛說眾許摩訶帝經卷第九
translation: Foshuo zhongshimahatei jing, vol. 9
